Class oracle.rdbms.Session 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index  OWS Table of Contents

Class oracle.rdbms.Session 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----oracle.rdbms.Session
public class Session
extends Object
This class provides access to Oracle database: log on to and log off from Oracle database, and perform database operations.

access
The monitor to serial access to Oracle.

Session()
Creates a new database session (not logged on).
Session(String, String, String)
Creates a new database session and logon.
Session(String)
Creates a new database session and logon.

autoCommit(boolean)
Specifies whether this session should perform commit immediately after each PL/SQL function call.
commit()
Commit database changes.
finalize()
Performs cleanup before this Session is garbage collected.
getProperty(String)
Returns Oracle's global environment.
isConnected()
Check if this session is connected or not.
logoff()
Logoff from database.
logon(String, String, String)
Logon to a database.
logon(String)
Logon to a database.
rollback()
Rollback database changes.
setProperty(String, String)
Sets Oracle's global environment.

access 
  public final static Object access
The monitor to serial access to Oracle. It should not be used by users.

Session 
  public Session()
Creates a new database session (not logged on).
See Also:
logon
Session 
  public Session(String username,
                 String password,
                 String connectStr) throws ServerException
Creates a new database session and logon.
Parameters:
username - the username used to logon
password - the user's password
connectStr - Oracle's connect string
Throws: ServerException
if logon fails
See Also:
logon
Session 
  public Session(String usernamePassword) throws ServerException
Creates a new database session and logon.
Parameters:
usernamePassword - the username/password@connect-string used to logon
Throws: ServerException
if logon fails
See Also:
logon

logon 
  public void logon(String username,
                    String password,
                    String connectStr) throws ServerException
Logon to a database.
Parameters:
username - the username used to logon
password - the user's password
connectStr - Oracle's connect string
Throws: ServerException
if logon fails
logon 
  public void logon(String usernamePassword) throws ServerException
Logon to a database.
Parameters:
usernamePassword - the username/password@connect-string used to logon
Throws: ServerException
if logon fails
logoff 
  public void logoff() throws ServerException
Logoff from database.
Throws: ServerException
if logon fails
commit 
  public void commit() throws ServerException
Commit database changes. This session will perform commit automatically by default when this session ends. This property can be changed by users.
Throws: ServerException
if commit fails
See Also:
autoCommit
rollback 
  public void rollback() throws ServerException
Rollback database changes.
Throws: ServerException
if rollback fails
autoCommit 
  public void autoCommit(boolean autoCommit) throws ServerException
Specifies whether this session should perform commit immediately after each PL/SQL function call. The default is auto-commit off.
Parameters:
autoCommit - true if auto-commit, false if not
Throws: ServerException
if fails to change auto-commit property
isConnected 
  public boolean isConnected() throws ServerException
Check if this session is connected or not.
Returns:
a boolean value indicating if this session is still connected
Throws: ServerException
if fails to detect connection
setProperty 
  public static void setProperty(String name,
                                 String value)
Sets Oracle's global environment. For example, ORACLE_HOME and TNS_ADMIN.
Parameters:
name - property name
value - property value
getProperty 
  public static String getProperty(String name)
Returns Oracle's global environment. For example, ORACLE_HOME and TNS_ADMIN.
Parameters:
name - property name
finalize 
  protected void finalize()
Performs cleanup before this Session is garbage collected.
Overrides:
finalize in class Object
